comment._content: Hey!  I was there just last week and took a rake of shots but did not try that POV.  Nice one Carol.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The cathedral is gorgeous, designed by Pugin it is beautifully decorated inside.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Pugin was a busy chap! And you might at least let me know your travel itinerary in advance of departure. Then I could check photos, and you could snoop around while you're gallivanting... :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 99002941@N08
comment._content: Woman in the center is wearing a hat and style that began in the early 1890s

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: J (Jacob) Boardman , grocer & publican, is on Market Street in 1901 but no Boardman's (men) there in 1911. 25" OSI (1903) Streetview

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/99002941@N08] Thank you - nudged the date up by a few years.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] Excellent that there were no Boardmen there in 1911! And thanks for Jacob - love changing an initial to the full name...

Also, great idea putting a date on the OSI Map link!!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: A red herring from Trove, describing Enniscorthy Fair in 1897 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/104404546

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Aha! The Market House (see note) - "the building was there during the 1798 Rising and like most of Enniscorthy was originally the property of Porthsmouth Estate. The present facade was developed in the latter part of the 19th century. ... " From www.enniscorthy.ie/ec/HeritageTrail/ So when did the Market House grow to three storeys? Only two here ...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] Brilliant, so this photo is definitely pre-1908 when the third storey was added to the Market House! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia]
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: I think we would also see the plinth of the "Pikemen" statue to left of frame if post 1908!!--- unveiled on May 31, 1908 Here's NLI Stereo of near same view-- Cathedral has no bell tower . Bell tower was added 1884. Date so far 1884-1908

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] And while fashion is not as reliable as a missing bell tower, don't forget [http://www.flickr.com/photos/99002941@N08] says Eliza Doolittle in the middle of the market there "is wearing a hat and style that began in the early 1890s"...

P.S. Love this eating away at either side of dates! Thanks.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
